text: so i've gotten this feedback from a few clients now but when adding content to the WYSIWYG editor via copy paste from other sources, its really adding alot of clutter to the source code, is there anyway to minimize this other than copy to notepad first then to editor
Hey AJ--we can definitely take a look. We're actually about to make a few adjustments to paste processing. Do you have any examples of clutter being added?
Hey Katie, let me ask the client. Ill get you some examples via a DM
Yep, i think thats the main issue they are seeing

according to the client:
>>>The editor within HubSpot is adding a lot of additional HTML code that tries to force non-template standard fonts, font sizes, line height, and spacing, etc.  Initially, we thought that this issue was caused by the content source format, which is typically Microsoft Word documents.   When copying un-formatted text content from Notepad++ or any other standard text editor, this issue was reproduced.

All of this “garbage” code is completely unnecessary, especially when we have predefined CSS within all of our templates.   Rendering of pages on different device types is the result.

[CMD + Option + shift + v] seems to be a “paste as plain text” that works across a few platforms.

I copy + paste from google docs to wordpress WYSIWYG and use that shortcut to speed things up.
how do you do this on Windows Macine?
looks like its ctrl + shift + v
yes! I was going to guess that but i was gonna boot up my windows laptop and confirm.
I know one other thing is when you press return, then go to a new line, instead of defaulting to `<p>`, it defaults to `<p> + additional formatting from prior heading.`
not sure on that one. maybe hitting return twice? like when you want to get out of a bullet list.
Tried that, still didnt do it
